alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued May 16 at 12:02PM HST until May 19 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY FOR BIG ISLAND SUMMITS... .A prolonged period of strong southwest winds will affect the high summits of the Big Island as an upper level trough approaches and moves over the state. The strong winds will persist through at least Thursday night and possibly through Friday. ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 55 mph with localized gusts over 60 mph. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can make driving and walking difficult. The winds can forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds may increase further to High Wind Warning strength.
info.instruction: Consider postponing travel to the summits until conditions improve. If you must travel to the summits, use extra caution walking and driving. Be careful opening or closing doors.
